definitions.definition: A cut or groove, as left by a gouge or something sharp.
definitions.example: The nail left a deep gouge in the tire.

definitions.definition: (originally United States) An act of gouging.
A cheat, a fraud; an imposition.
Soft material lying between the wall of a vein and the solid vein of ore.
To make a groove, hole, or mark in by scooping with or as if with a gouge.
definitions.example: Japanese and Chinese printers used to gouge characters in wood.

definitions.definition: To cheat or impose upon; in particular, to charge an unfairly or unreasonably high price.
definitions.example: The company has no competition, so it tends to gouge its customers.

definitions.definition: To dig or scoop (something) out with or as if with a gouge; in particular, to use a thumb to push or try to push the eye (of a person) out of its socket.
